intro: Brachystelma commixtum, commonly known as the mixed-stemed stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers that often resemble insects. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its compact growth habit and vibrant flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens. Brachystelma commixtum is known for its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves.
